sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of financial fraud occurring in a company
message_1: What is the probability that a company will experience financial fraud in a given year, if the historical data shows that 10 out of 100 companies experience fraud every year?
message_2:
The probability that a company will experience financial fraud in a given year can be calculated using the historical data provided. 

Number of companies that experience fraud = 10
Total number of companies = 100

Probability of a company experiencing financial fraud in a given year = (Number of companies that experience fraud) / (Total number of companies) = 10 / 100 = 1 / 10 = 0.1

So, the probability is 0.1 or 10%.
